Table of Contents

Interface IRSSReaderDbContext

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Database
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Core interface for the RSS Reader's Entity Framework Core database context. Defines standardized access to database operations, transaction management, raw SQL execution, maintenance tasks, and basic statistics — with full async support.

public interface IRSSReaderDbContext : IAsyncDisposable
Inherited Members
IAsyncDisposable.DisposeAsync()

Remarks

This interface abstracts the underlying DbContext implementation and is intended to be:

  • Implemented by the actual DbContext class (e.g., RssReaderDbContext : DbContext, IRssReaderDbContext)
  • Injected via dependency injection into services, repositories, and background workers
  • Used consistently across the application to ensure proper async/await usage and transaction safety

Key design principles:

  • All mutating operations should prefer transactional execution (via ExecuteInTransactionAsync)
  • Raw SQL methods are provided for performance-critical or SQLite-specific operations (VACUUM, PRAGMA, etc.)
  • Maintenance methods (Backup, Vacuum, Reset) are exposed for admin/debug flows and automated cleanup
  • Statistics are lightweight and suitable for periodic health checks or UI dashboard display

Important notes for implementers and consumers:

  • The context is expected to use SQLite (based on DatabasePath and Vacuum/Backup methods)
  • Implementations should handle connection pooling, retry logic, and concurrency appropriately
  • Do not call SaveChanges/SaveChangesAsync directly on the underlying DbContext from consumers — use transactional wrappers
  • Cancellation support is mandatory on all async methods

Properties

DatabasePath

Gets the full file-system path to the SQLite database file.

string? DatabasePath { get; }

Property Value

string

Remarks

Used for backup operations, file existence checks, and diagnostics. Returns null if using in-memory database (testing scenarios).

Methods

ApplyMigrationsAsync(CancellationToken)

Explicitly applies any pending EF Core migrations to the database.

Task ApplyMigrationsAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task

Remarks

Usually called internally by EnsureDatabaseCreatedAsync, but exposed for manual migration scenarios.

BackupAsync(string, CancellationToken)

Creates a full backup copy of the SQLite database file.

Task BackupAsync(string backupPath, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

backupPath string

Target path where the backup file will be saved (must include .db extension).

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task

Remarks

Uses SQLite backup API for consistency and minimal locking. Throws if target path exists or is inaccessible.

BeginTransactionAsync(IsolationLevel, CancellationToken)

Begins a new database transaction with the specified isolation level.

Task<IDbContextTransaction> BeginTransactionAsync(IsolationLevel isolationLevel = IsolationLevel.ReadCommitted, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

isolationLevel IsolationLevel

Defaults to ReadCommitted — safest for most operations.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<IDbContextTransaction>

An IDbContextTransaction that must be committed or rolled back.

Remarks

Prefer ExecuteInTransactionAsync<T>(Func<Task<T>>, IsolationLevel, CancellationToken) for most use cases. Manual transaction usage requires proper disposal.

EnsureDatabaseCreatedAsync(CancellationToken)

Ensures the database file exists and all pending migrations are applied. Safe to call on application startup.

Task EnsureDatabaseCreatedAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task

ExecuteInTransactionAsync<T>(Func<Task<T>>, IsolationLevel, CancellationToken)

Executes the provided async action inside a new transaction. Automatically commits on success or rolls back on exception.

Task<T> ExecuteInTransactionAsync<T>(Func<Task<T>> action, IsolationLevel isolationLevel = IsolationLevel.ReadCommitted, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

action Func<Task<T>>

The async lambda or method to execute transactionally.

isolationLevel IsolationLevel

Transaction isolation level (default: ReadCommitted).

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<T>

The result returned by the action.

Type Parameters

T

Return type of the operation (use Unit/Task for void operations).

Remarks

Recommended pattern for all write operations that should be atomic. Example: await db.ExecuteInTransactionAsync(async () => { await db.Articles.AddAsync(...); await db.SaveChangesAsync(); });

ExecuteRawQueryAsync<T>(string, CancellationToken, params object[])

Executes a raw SQL SELECT query and maps results to a list of entities of type T.

Task<List<T>> ExecuteRawQueryAsync<T>(string sql, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default, params object[] parameters) where T : class

Parameters

sql string

Parameterized SQL query (use {0}, {1} placeholders or named parameters).

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

parameters object[]

Values to bind to the query parameters.

Returns

Task<List<T>>

List of materialized entities.

Type Parameters

T

Entity type with properties matching column names.

Remarks

Use for complex queries or performance-critical reads that cannot be expressed via LINQ. Does not track entities by default.

ExecuteSqlCommandAsync(string, CancellationToken, params object[])

Executes a non-query SQL command (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, PRAGMA, etc.).

Task<int> ExecuteSqlCommandAsync(string sql, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default, params object[] parameters)

Parameters

sql string

Parameterized SQL command.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

parameters object[]

Values to bind.

Returns

Task<int>

Number of rows affected.

Remarks

Ideal for bulk operations, schema changes, or SQLite-specific commands.

GetStatisticsAsync(CancellationToken)

Retrieves lightweight database statistics (size, counts, last backup).

Task<DatabaseStatsDto> GetStatisticsAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task<DatabaseStatsDto>

A DatabaseStatsDto object with current metrics.

Remarks

Should be fast enough for periodic UI refresh or health monitoring. Counts are approximate when called concurrently with writes.

ResetDatabaseAsync(CancellationToken)

Deletes all data from all tables (truncate-like behavior) while preserving schema. Intended for development, testing, or user-initiated "clear all data" actions.

Task ResetDatabaseAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task

Remarks

Should be wrapped in a transaction and confirmed by user. Does not drop/recreate the database file.

VacuumAsync(CancellationToken)

Executes SQLite VACUUM command to reclaim unused space and defragment the database file.

Task VacuumAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Task

Remarks

Useful after bulk deletes (e.g., article cleanup, archiving). May take significant time on large databases — run in background.
